case_summary.outcome: Total loss - website offline, no fund recovery

initial_contact.platform: Direct to website (no apparent social engineering)

relationship_development.note: Minimal relationship building - direct platform fraud

wallet_addresses.note: Specific wallet addresses not disclosed in complaint; funds deposited to exchange-controlled addresses

attack_details: Backend designed for one-way fund flow
Account flags or verification loops prevent withdrawals
No actual technical exploit - architectural fraud

withdrawal_prevention.method: Platform withdrawal blocking + progressive fee extortion
withdrawal_prevention.justification_provided: VIP status requirement to unlock withdrawals

additional_fees_demanded.justification: Required deposit to obtain VIP status for withdrawal access
Further deposit requirement after first payment

red_flags: Customer support demanding large additional deposits for withdrawals
VIP status requirement for basic withdrawal functionality
Extremely high deposit requirement (50,000 USDT) to unlock withdrawals
Combination of large deposit and small insurance fee (psychological manipulation)
Moving goalposts - second 50,000 USDT demand after compliance
No regulatory licensing or exchange verification
Platform not listed on reputable exchange directories
Generic domain name (bybukx.com) without brand recognition
Complete website shutdown without user notice
No recovery mechanism or support after shutdown
Deposits work perfectly but withdrawals completely blocked

victim_profile.crypto_experience: Moderate to High (conducting ETH to USDT conversions, has primary exchange)
victim_profile.recruitment_vector: Direct platform discovery (search, ads, or referral)
vulnerability_exploited: Sunk cost fallacy after initial deposit

exit_strategy.evidence_destruction: Website shutdown eliminates evidence and user access

initial_access.description: Victim discovered fraudulent platform through web search or advertisement

persistence.description: Platform maintains control of deposited funds through withdrawal blocking

defense_evasion.description: Platform masqueraded as legitimate cryptocurrency exchange

collection.description: Platform collected cryptocurrency deposits from victims

impact.description: Stole 50,003+ USDT through deposit trap and extortion

threat_actor_assessment.technical_capability: Functional cryptocurrency exchange development with deposit/conversion capability
threat_actor_assessment.operational_security: Good - successful exit scam, evidence removal
threat_actor_assessment.targeting: Opportunistic - targeting crypto users seeking exchange services
threat_actor_assessment.infrastructure: Professional fraudulent exchange platform with customer support
threat_actor_assessment.modus_operandi: Honeypot exchange with withdrawal blocking and progressive extortion

attack_chain_summary.step_2: Account Creation - Victim opens account on fraudulent exchange
attack_chain_summary.step_4: Conversion - Platform converts ETH to USDT (functionality works)
attack_chain_summary.step_5: Withdrawal Block - Victim attempts withdrawal, platform blocks transaction
attack_chain_summary.step_6: Customer Support Contact - Victim contacts support seeking help
attack_chain_summary.step_7: VIP Status Demand - Support demands 50,000 USDT + 3 USDT for VIP status
attack_chain_summary.step_9: Second Demand - Platform demands another 50,000 USDT
attack_chain_summary.step_10: Victim Refuses - Victim recognizes scam pattern, refuses second payment
attack_chain_summary.step_11: Exit Scam - Platform shuts down, victim loses all funds

prevention: Only use well-known, verified cryptocurrency exchanges
Check exchange listings on CoinMarketCap, CoinGecko, etc.
Verify exchange regulatory licensing (FinCEN, state licenses)
Research exchange reputation through crypto communities
Test withdrawals with small amounts before large deposits
Never deposit large sums to unlock withdrawal functionality
Be suspicious of unknown exchanges with perfect deposit functionality
Check domain age and registration information
Look for exchange reviews and complaint history
Verify exchange social media presence and community engagement
detection: Withdrawal blocking after successful deposit is major red flag
Large additional deposits required for basic functionality
VIP status or tier requirements for withdrawals
Combination of large and trivial fees (psychological manipulation)
Customer support that only offers payment solutions
Lack of regulatory information or licensing
Domain not recognized in crypto exchange directories
No social media presence or community reviews
response: Stop all payments immediately upon first extortion demand
Report to IC3 (FBI), FTC, FinCEN, and state financial regulators
Document all transactions, communications, and demands
Preserve blockchain transaction records and screenshots
Do NOT pay additional fees or deposits
Warn crypto community through forums and social media
Report domain to abuse databases and registrars
Consider consulting crypto recovery specialists (verify legitimacy)
Alert other potential victims through crypto safety communities

unique_characteristics: No apparent social engineering or relationship building
Functional deposit and conversion system (higher technical sophistication)
Progressive extortion with identical second demand (50k USDT twice)
Small insurance fee (3 USDT) combined with large deposit requirement
deviation_from_typical_pig_butchering: No romantic or business relationship development
Less social engineering, more platform-based fraud
Positioned as exchange service rather than investment opportunity
